place_description: Cool craft brewery with an industrial-chic tasting room & innovative beer flavors.

reviews_data.review_text: Friendly and cool spot!
Great beers and service

I really enjoyed this brewery. Simple, yet complicated at the same time. I had the German Pills and the Oktoberfest. The pills was standard, but the Oktoberfest was, pun intended, Divine. I found myself reminiscing of it even as I was leaving.

This is not a brewery I will soon forget.
10/10 recommend for a private party! Jake was so responsive and accommodating during planning and the space was PERFECT for an engagement party. We had the best time!

Great relaxing atmosphere and came into town while an NFL game was going on. Everywhere else was packed and rowdy. This place was still chill even with the game going.
Beer was great
The beer is great. The people are nice. What more do you want? Don't be a freak.

Love this place! They have creative non-alcoholic options for those of us who can't drink (the lavender soda Moon and the Fog is just *beautiful!* and light on the sugar) and the vibe is always very chill when I've been. They also have rotating pinball machines and I can't resist Ghost Busters when it's there! The staff is super friendly and there's lots of free parking on the lot across the street which is a hard find in the Noda area!
Moment of Divine Clarity was so much fun. DJ was fire and the beer was tasty
I enjoyed the hell out of myself here with a lot of friendly people.
Best brewery in Charlotte.
Comfortable seating and good beer

Great beer, good space, and incredibly nice people. Appreciated the options (I love sours and I think they had 4 or so when we went). Boyfriend loved Dank Zappa IPA (both the beer and the pun). We were just visiting the area but if I lived in Charlotte this would definitely be my go-to. Bartender recommended some other local breweries too, and the ones we checked out did not disappoint. LONG LIVE BAT BOY.

Great brewery - the vibe and the beers a re just right. I like the Czech Pilsner, Life flows on (Amber) and the hoppy Dank Zappa (West coat IPA).
There are plenty event around the brewery (Food truck festivals, live music). It's a great place to hang out.

Drinking for years and finally got to visit. Love this place and especially the exceptionally creative labels on the beer. I feel like I get an idea of the spirit of the drink from the labels.

if you are new to Divine, I would encourage getting a flight so you can sample the variety because it's easy to drink here. Atmosphere is very chill and relaxed.
The best brewery in Charlotte. Amazing staff, super friendly atmosphere. A must-visit in you're in the area!
Great atmosphere, and I've never had a bad beer here!

Tucked away spot that really is a gem..

The place just feels like good energy.
Beertender was super cool. Had a nice chat and he pointed me in the direction of some other must try breweries while I was in town..

Spacious with a cool rustic yet modern warehouse type of feel.  Small poured a handful of their IPAs and was not disappointed.  Everything was clean,  balanced,  delicious.. I'm a fan.

Didn't ask the story behind the name.. Google here I come.

This place right here!!! I tell you, we had NO idea that this brewery existed, but sooo glad we did!  The whole vibe and atmosphere there was awesome. The staff was cool and very friendly, and the art! These guys really seem to support local art. They had some amazing pieces around the room, and supposedly they switch it up monthly to support new artists. Me & the crew may have found our new favorite hangout spot!
Great service and always a beer on tap that I like. Dog friendly too!
Fantastic drink selections and local social events
We love this little brewery tucked away near NODA
Super cool owner and great beer! Highly recommend!
Solid brewery... had a little bit of everything as far as beer is concerned. Ipa's, hazy's, dark, crisp, sour's... also a couple of draft cocktails!

To say this place is a diamond in the rough is an understatement!! We reserved Divine Barrel Brewing for our son's post-wedding brunch. From the first time I met Jake Bock and his team, I was put at ease. From the scheduling to the organizing and set-up, was nothing short of professional and effortless! Everyone we met was extremely courteous and friendly! They helped any way they could and made sure that us and our guests were comfortable and had a great time! They truly went above and beyond and made this groom's mother one happy person!!! Thank you Jake and crew for helping to make our event one very special and memorable one!!!
The vibes are immaculate: great music, video games, and great non alcoholic options (try the cream soda). Not to mention the staff are so kind!

I've been going to DBB since it opened, and it's really cool to see the true community hub it's grown into. Service is always top notch across the board, and it's clear how committed they are to showcasing local artists & food vendors (their truck rotation is terrific). The NoDaHood markets they host every few months are always a blast.

For their core offerings - the taproom & patio atmospheres are welcoming to everyone and really clean; they recently added some pinball machines to compliment all of the tabletop and board games.

And last but certainly not least - the beer. They'll almost always have something for everyone; clean classics, fun sours, heavier dark beers, stuff that's barrel-aged, solid cocktails, wine, and n/a offerings that are tasty and open the place up even more to families.

They do a little bit of everything and do it well. They're THE destination for me when I get to that part of the city.
Knowledgable and attentive staff, fun environment, and damn good beer. Taylor was a phenomenal bartender!

One of my favorite breweries in all of Charlotte, NC.  They aren't afraid to experiment with different styles of beer. Large venue, small record store and a number of non alcoholic and non beer options.
Pleasant place
My favorite brewery, great selection, great people
The best beers in charlotte
One of my favorite breweries, one of the best in NoDa
Our favorite brewery in Charlotte. The IPA's and cobbler inspired sours are the best.

I hosted a Christmas party in the Barrel Room and it was absolutely perfect! The room was nicely set up when I got there, the staff were wonderful, and the atmosphere was just what I was looking for. Everyone had a great time and I would highly recommend Divine Barrel for your future events or as a place to go for good beer! Thank you Divine Barrel!
Keep pouring

Oysters were delicious and they even accommodated my request, dry roasted!
All of the other foods were fresh cooked and piping hot.
Loved the music too.
Every one of the workers and volunteers were delightful as well!

Best brewery in NoDa. Great staff. Great Beer. Nightly events.
best trivia in Charlotte Monday nights.
Wonderful beers and great service! Jake and Ady were wonderful!
Great vibes, the beers are crispy and delightful. Good seltzers too.
Awesome brewery!  The place is very inviting and comfortable, the staff is terrific and engaging, and the beer/drinks are terrific!  Highly recommend to visit!
My wife and I found the DB pilsner to be one of the best in the Carolinas. We happily drive east to Charlotte from western NC just to bring home some goodness.  Great staff too.
Nice atmosphere, relaxing, good beer selection, and fun trivia. Enjoyed myself there. Prices are competitive, too, and they had a food truck out back. Would recommend to anyone-!
Great beers and vibe. Must stop when I am in Charlotte. Highly recommend.

I didn't think I could love Divine Barrel more until they had drag brunch! It was an amazing event! The entertainment was top-notch! Onya Nerves knows how to put together a wonderful set! I can't wait to come back for brunch!

Divine Barrel is like the bar from Cheers, once you're a regular, the staff all know your name! It's a great brewery, lots of variety in beer options, lots of activities during the week, and dog friendly.

Another great NoDa brewery to enjoy. Great on tap beer selections. No grub prepared here, but they have a variety of bagged fare (popcorn, pretzels, chips) in various flavors. A food truck comes when weather permits. Jake, the bartender, is one of the most friendiest folks you could ever have an opportunity to meet. Nice place to meet up with friends while enjoying a cold craft. An array of activities noted on different nights of the week to keep you coming back.

Hands down one of the best breweries in Charlotte. Jake, Victoria, and the rest of the DBB staff make this a welcoming environment with excellent service and high quality beer. If you're looking for good beer, great astomosphere, and excellent service; you gotta hit up DBB.
Divine Barrel is officially my new favorite brewery in Charlotte. This place rocks.

Stumbled across this place on a kpop dance party night and was not disappointed. Only reason I'm leaving 4 starts in the cover charge of $10 which I assume is not typical. I feel like the atmosphere here usually different than the time I went but it was still fun.

This place is awesome. The have a really good food truck everyday. Their beers are so freaking tasty. Love their sours.
Went there for the Barcerado and Raspberry Pie show. So much fun.  Thank you DBB for having them there.

Me and my Partner have been coming here consistently for quite a while. This is our comfort brewery for sure! The beer is amazing, and the staff is the friendliest you'll find. The atmosphere is super cozy, clean, and pretty. Bathrooms are always clean, outdoor seating is really nice. It's so hard to find a place that is 10/10 for all of these things. If you're thinking about trying it out, do yourself a favor! Oh and the moonbeams stout is fantastic.

My absolute favorite brewery. I make the drive from Rock Hill up this way when I can. They have the best hazy IPAs and sours. The staff is always super friendly and they are pup friendly inside since they don't serve food. Parking can be a bit of a challenge at times but I think that's just NoDa!
Nice spot tucked away on N. Davidson. Not too crowded on a Friday afternoon but I think we beat the crowd. Excellent choice of beer and cider.  We will visit again!
Friendly staff, nice atmosphere and a really yummy imperial stout!
Great place, nice people , excellent beers

A Spirited Journey at Divine Barrel Brewing

Rating:  5/5

Last weekend, I had the pleasure of visiting Divine Barrel Brewing, a hidden gem nestled in the heart of Charlotte. From the moment I walked in, I was captivated by the warm and inviting atmosphere, the delightful fusion of old-world charm and modern flair, and the genuine passion for brewing that emanated from every corner of the establishment.

Ambiance:  5/5
The brewery boasts an impeccably designed space, combining rustic wood accents with sleek industrial elements to create a one-of-a-kind environment. The outdoor patio area, adorned with string lights, is perfect for soaking in the local vibes and enjoying a pint with friends on a warm evening.

Beer Selection:  5/5
Divine Barrel Brewing takes pride in their extensive and diverse beer selection. From traditional styles like IPAs and stouts to more experimental offerings like sours and barrel-aged brews, there's a beer for every palate. I was particularly impressed by their commitment to sourcing local ingredients and the intriguing seasonal options that showcased the creativity of their master brewer.

Service:  5/5
The staff at Divine Barrel Brewing are friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to help you find your perfect pint. Their enthusiasm for craft beer is contagious, making it a joy to learn about the brewing process and the stories behind each brew. They truly elevated the experience.

Love Divine Barrel Brewing in Charlotte NC! Been here a bunch of times. They have an amazing selection of beers including my favorite, sours! They had one collar with Salud- Hermosa Tonteria- was the best/ was in a can tho. I had another delicious sour on draft. Blood orange , pineapple and mango- omg amaze! Love the outdoor space, so did my two dogs. They are next door to Deejai and Craft wine! So excited to come back and try new things!!
We visited for their 5 year anniversary and it was so much fun! The beer was good and the band was awesome!
Great place, unless it's crowded, which is most of the time.
Great place, great staff, great beer. Definitely a local favorite.
What great flavor profiles they have for beers.  Some traditional beers but their takes on flavors is extraordinary.   Flights available.
Simply divine people in a great atmosphere!  I want to go and take my dog there . . . every day!!  <3
Live music and fantastic beer. Ask for florida seltzer
Excellent craft brewery famous for inventive sours and other styles tucked away behind another event space - entrance is on the side. Friendly staff serving up great beer!
Great beer selection and atmosphere.  However, they need to do something about the smell....strong farm animal smell. Was with a group of 7 and we left quickly after one round.

Love this brewery. Good people, good beer, doing good things for the community. Friendly bar staff, and a clean atmosphere. And dog friendly? Yes, yes please. I'll pair pups and pints any day. Oh, and it's totally ok to come hungry - they have food trucks all the time!
Staff told me that they're selling throughout NC, really excited to be able to pick it up at my favorite bottle shop when I'm not on this side of town. See you again soon DBB!

I always have a good time here. The staff is friendly and knows their beer!

The location is big enough to not feel crowded but still feels homey.

The last time I was there they even had an artist doing free caricatures which was really fun. The artist was also a super nice guy.

Excellent place that's well worth a stop.
Best sours in Charlotte
Great stop for a drink, amazing selections. Loved the atmosphere. Food trucks right outside. Pet friendly. The staff was very friendly. And clean bathrooms.
One of our favorite places in NODA.
Delicious sour beer. Nice vibe inside
Such fantastic beer! Loved the Defensive Pancake and the Crooked Paint Job. Ordered a noodle bowl from Deejai's - also fabulous! Great atmosphere!
Beer and service was great.
Amazing beer, great vibes and tremendous people!!
Best brewery in CLT, hands down.
I've been going to Divine since they opened. This place is just consistently fantastic! The beer is the best in Charlotte, the people are always friendly, and the atmosphere is just spot on!

Good beer in a good location. I enjoy making the rounds of the Charlotte area breweries and this is a good one. I enjoy the selection of beers, and it is well located in the northern section of noda where you will find parking and other places to drop in for food and drinks.
Nice and inviting brewery with good beer.
Consistently the best brewery in Charlotte. Well crafted beers with many styles, both fad and otherwise.
Great ambiance and really tasty beer! Fun hangout spot with great service.

Divine Barrel is quickly becoming one of my favorite NC craft breweries. Tucked away cool little spot in the Northeast of Charlotte in the NoDa district Divine Barrel offers some truly unique beers.

I first encountered Divine Barrel in Wilmington Nc where I tried the Lunchbox Confidential and Holy Cow it's a Peanut Butter and Jelly sandwich in a can. I was super excited about finally getting to visit the tap house.

The space is super cool with a large outdoor patio and plenty of seating inside. We got a flight and really enjoyed every expression they offered. The Ice cream Paint job and Lunchbox were super crushable!

Can't wait for another visit which shhh (I'm headed there now)
Great beer! Huge amount of taps for a brewery. I shall return!
Excellent warm welcoming atmosphere. Czech Pils and Barleywine were on point!

Fabulous brewery with a huge selection of brew styles. Food delivery available from many different places. Usually has a food truck in the parking lot.  Great service. Very enjoyable experience. Parking is not good, but the beer is worth the trouble to park.
One of the BEST breweries around. Unusually lovely and kind staff. I feel so warm going here  such a great vibe and their IPAs and sours are top notch
Great music venue, even better beer!
Great beers, especially the sours, ambiance, and service! No food is served here but there is a food truck outside.
Great drinks and friendly staff!
This is the best brewery in Charlotte.  Great beer, great service, excellent atmosphere, what else could you want?
Nice space with good variety of styles, all done very well.
Fun place, great variety of flavor profiles. All I tasted I liked! Dog-friendly indoors with AC is perfect for a summer beer stop with Stella!
Great atmosphere, even better beer!

I love coming out to Divine Barrel! The staff is very helpful and makes me feel very welcome when I visit. The beer is always flavorful and some of them have very interesting tastes. There is always something new to try too. I can't wait to visit again when I am in Noda!
Nice brewery. Chill spot to hangout and get drinks. Good beer always helps with the vibe.
Visited for the first time today for the CLT Social Club event. They had food trucks and great beer/seltzer options. We met some great new friends at the event as well
Amazing tucked away place. Much larger than it seems from the outside. Great list of beers to choose from. Staff is super friendly and welcoming.
Whoever is driving your Van today is going to cause an accident is making your business look terrible
Awesome beers, great place. Wrestling today!
Great beer here and a good place to watch a game if they pull down the video screen.
Wonderful atmosphere. Great beers. I would send my nemesis to enjoy a beer.

This brewery is one of NoDa's best! A spacious and atmospheric taproom hold plenty of things to do and brews to enjoy. A spacious outdoor seating area provides a COVID-friendly space to enjoy Divine beer! Definitely check them out!
Great beer and great atmosphere!
One of the best breweries in the NODA area of Charlotte. Loved the atmosphere and the people.
It is a very nice place. The atmosphere and unique beers were great. My son and his band Jonathan Scales Fourchestra performed there. I definitely recommend checking it out
What a wonderful time, just loved the sour and my hubby enjoyed his double IPA very much. I will revisit this place again

Really nice brewery with lots of beer types to try. I love that they offer smaller pours as well as flights so you can try more than a few. The venue is beautiful and the staff was friendly. We loved all the dogs there too. We visited on a Saturday afternoon and a food truck was set up. The only downside is parking, but there is a gravel lot in front of an industrial building across the street that we had no problem with parking in.
Enjoyed a nice kombucha while my friends had beer. Nice space that felt roomy. Pleasant staff and a good experience.
Great atmosphere and well made beers. Solid rotating selection of beer styles including the best gratzer you can find in the area.
I have tried multiple different styles and they are all amazing.  Best brewery in Charlotte!
Great atmosphere, nice and helpful staff, excellent beer and a good variety of choices!

One of my absolute favorite breweries in charlotte. All of their beers are delicious and they have a wide variety of styles. Also of high importance, they have an N64 and a bunch of games, and they show nerdy movie marathons and decorate the whole place to match (Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings). Overall, great beer great vibes.
I was VERY impressed with their summer flavors. Not so much in the fall winter nothing seasonal that caught my eye but a great space and nice people!
Friendly bartenders, tasty brews
Nice atmosphere, dogs allowed, awesome selection of beers including sours & porters, food cart available outside.
Great beer, good people, local artists.
In my opinion they have some of the best beers in Charlotte
Honestly have loved 95+% of the beers I've had here. Phenomenal.
Freaking awesome place. Owner is dope! Great beer!
Yummy beers. A few things a little different than the regulars
One of my favorite breweries in town. They make some of the best sours I've ever had. Great place to watch a game and they also have an n64
Delicious beer and a great variety. I'll definitely be back someday.

The beer looks amazing! Graphic design and descriptions, as well as creative concoctions are all on point; but how does it taste? Amazing. It's bonkers some of the flavors they come up with, but they're as delicious as their descriptors and sometimes more so! A definite must try for those that like flavor, beer and good atmosphere!

Beers here are well constructed and very flavorful. I would give at least 4 stars, maybe five if they did not allow dogs in tasting room which I thought was not allowed. The pour acoustics and barking dogs does not make for an enjoyable experience here!
Update 9/18/21
Beers are very good, here for Oktoberfest, their Marzen was best in town, staff very friendly, dog issue not as bad as previous. Great craft beer spot
Great atmosphere and good sour / fruit beers.  Not sure if there's always a food truck outside, but there was when I went

Great beer spot specializing in sours! Super friendly staff! They do offer a few other styles of beer, but sours are what they're known for. I always order half pours which allows me to try a few different ones. Drank 3 different sours and they did not disappoint! Also, the restrooms were super clean!
Great beer selection
Cool place! Homey. Lots of seating. Great beers!
Great beers, great taproom, awesome staff, great ambiance.
Divine Barrel is amazing. So many great beers. Unpretentious atmosphere. Friendly service. Lots of fun games.
Excellent downtown pub with fine selection of local brews and wines.

Updated my review here..5/5 Great brewery.. That produces some great and well balanced beer. My only gripe is they call themselves Divine "Barrel" and every time I have gone in there they have yet to have any barrel aged beer..  Still, the beers are good and service is very friendly.
One of my top 5 breweries in Charlotte, and that's saying something. Great variety of styles. One of the few places you can still find a proper West Coast IPA. #brewon
Phish!! Great beers and atmosphere!
Awesome spot, with a really nice staff. Tasted all the beers on tap and they all were well balanced and blended beers. Good IPAs and Sours. Certainly a gem.
Incredible beer with a variety of styles. Welcoming staff and awesome music selection. Love this place.
Great service and selection! Great place to come with friends or make new ones. Thanks Joel
Great beer, good atmosphere. Some very unique pours.
One of the best breweries in Charlotte. Lots of fun events and activities.  Park across the street!

We go here often. By far my favorite beer selection of any brewery in CLT. While many breweries stick to a similar formula, DBB always pushes the boundaries and there's ALWAYS new stuff every time you go. Shout out to having 5oz options and flights to affordably try multiple variations! Also don't miss the trivia on Mondays! Huge indoor space, great patio, and the staff are always great.
Awesome drinks and cool atmosphere!!! Will definitely be back!
Great selection of beers appropriate to the season, really nice atmosphere, lots of seating, and not very busy. Staff were very helpful and friendly.

Always a wonderful experience. The space is beautiful & has parking (which is rare in NoDa). The beer is always amazing, I haven't had something I don't like yet! The staff is also always wonderful. One of our favorites for sure!
Great beers and very friendly bartenders! I've had a great experience here every time I have visited!

Best fruity beers in Charlotte, parking is limited but its never super packed. They know how to brew beer here. Something for everyone, their best beers are a blueberry cobbler, cherry connick junior, raspberry gose, etc. I would love to see this brewery expand because they have true potential and are very talented, Cheers!
Divine has great beers and great spaces. Always a good time
Some interesting flavor profiles.  Dig the Phish themed varieties but I'm a phan so I'm a bit biased.  Overall great atmosphere.  Telling phriends and will be back.
This might be the best brewery in Charlotte. Staff is friendly and fun and the beer is fantastic. This is a must if you are spending time in a Charlotte.
There's a reason we come here every Wednesday... good beer, good service, good people.  They always have a great selection of beer which is great for a group of people who have different tastes

I really enjoy the Divine Barrel! I especially like the tall bartender- Jake, I think his name is. He reminds me of  Pippin Brandybuck, as he is delightfully uncoordinated and sweet. Will return for Jake as much as for the beer!
If you like to pick your beers based on the clever names that the marketing geniuses devise then this is a great place to visit.  If you prefer to do it based on flavor ymmv.
Great place and great people
Super comfortable place to enjoy great beers. Dog friendly.

Hand down the best beer we've had in Charlotte. Decent sized indoor and outdoor space to hang with friends. All of the bartenders were super knowledgeable and friendly. You can order food from the noodle bar next door and they'll even deliver it to you!
Can't wait to come back and try more beers. The blueberry cobbler and donut stout were our favorites.

Absolutely love coming to Divine Barrel. The beers are always good, you can tell how much time, effort and craft they put into each one.  I always walk away with a 4-pack at least.  The vibe here is always chill too.  Come with friends, come by yourself... I am glad they are here in Charlotte
Great place with an awesome selection of beverages with creatively named beverages!

One of Best Breweries in Charlotte!!

Overall: we can't say enough great things about Divine Brewing. We had the chance to visit 7 breweries on our weekend trip to Charlotte and this was one of absolute favorites!! Everything you could want in a great experience at a brewery. Beer is fantastic across the board. The service was helpful and friendly. Cool interior and outside seating. Several food trucks in the area and excellent merch to top it off. We had several flights and came back the following day on the way out of town to grab some to go as well, including two glasses, and a tshirt. This ranks up there with some our favorite all-time along with Sweetwater (ATL), Slow Pour (Lawrenceville, GA), Creature Comforts (Athens, GA), and Against the Grain (Louisville). Amazing!!!
'
Beer: almost everything we tried we loved. Got two flights and went back for more. We had their Double Rainbow (9/10), Blueberry Cobbler (10/10), Cherry Connick (9/10) and several others were strong too, Casual (7/10) and Zappa (7/10). The Cobbler was so good that we went back the next day on the way out of town to grab a to-go. We also grabbed a single of Fritter Waste (cinnamon sticks and apple fritter with cake batter sour ale). You heard me correctly!  :)

Service: extremely friendly, helpful, and welcoming both times we came in.

Location/Interior/Patio: it is definitely tucked away a little bit north of the NoDa area. We took the light rail to 36th street station and Google Maps took us all over the place, when there was a more direct route. It is very non-descript in a more industrial place, but is located by a bar and grill and noodle shop. That area seems to be booming with new construction going on all around. Interior is cool with tables and couches. Outside is not terribly big, but it was perfect for a pretty sunny day.

Merch: they have some really cool merchandise. They have really cool glasses, a great logo, multitude of tshirts, bundles, and really cool artwork for their beers.

Summary: one of our favorite breweries we've ever visited!!
Excellent! Great brews, friendly staff, and good Covid awareness. We sat outside and enjoyed a beautiful Sunday afternoon.
The fritter will change your life. Outstanding service and atmosphere.
Great beer selection. Friendly service.
My favorite brewery in Charlotte. Great people making terrific beer.
Great beer and they run a great operation even during Covid. Lots of taps so you can always find something you like.

Love the atmosphere at this place. The building is awesome and staff is super friendly. The beer is above average but not awesome. Had a flight which included the donut stout which was the best. Kind of a dessert stout. The peanut butter and pecan stout were a little weird tasting for me. The Pilsner was definitely my least favorite. My buddy had an ipa which was pretty awesome. Not my favorite but can see why some people love it. Must give it a try.
Love, love, love this brewery.
Great beers, staff and spot!
Love the variety of beers here! Staff is always super helpful when picking out styles.
Phenomenal food and drinks here. Love the atmosphere/decor and the selection. Probably one of my favorite food venues in Charlotte!

My favorite brewery in the Charlotte, NC area without question!  Their IPAs and sours are my go to beers and their crowlers are great for beer to go!  Behind the great beer are great people as well.  The owners and staff are amazing and make a true connection with their customers.  If you make Divine a regular stop you will end up building a friendship with those who work there and there isn't much better than grabbing a great beer with friends!
This place is fantastic!  Lots of amazing beer, but the best Kolsch (Dad Noises) I've ever had - by far!  Definitely check out the Schwarzbier (When Will Then Be Now?), as well!
Hands down the best brewery in Charlotte!
You're a towel, I'm a towel, we're all towels. All Towel all the time. Great New England IPA!!!
Awesome beer selection in a beautiful taproom!  Bring back ice cream paint job, the original.

DBB is one of the absolute BEST breweries in the USofA! The owners are kind, community oriented, and all-around awesome people. The staff - ditto! The atmosphere is warm and welcoming. They have also done an A+ job during Covid with safety measures, making customers feel even more at ease. Run, don't walk, to Divine Barrel - you won't regret one minute!
Fantastic atmosphere, top notch beers, and excellent service!
Awesome beers, great atmosphere, and always the best food trucks! Highly recommend!
Great beer and awesome tap room!
Really praise this brewery for the covid safety precautions that they have put into play. If you like sours or good quality IPAs, this brewery will not disappoint. Cheers to divine barrel.
Great beers, friendly staff and dog friendly. We'll be back.

Best brewery in Charlotte. Their beer quality, selection, and rotation is always fantastic. They also carry other great drinks: wine, cold brew, kombucha, etc. The tap room atmosphere is laid back- fun games. Great customer service with a passion for being local to NoDa. Their delivery service has been excellent during Covid. Can't recommend enough!
Super nice. Really good beers. Try the party in my head.

This place a nice selection of beers.  It's not a bunch of IPAs.  They really mix it up.  I mean they even have Prosecco on tap.  The Lime Lager is solid, but boy oh boy do they have some great NE IPAs.  The atmosphere is inviting the stall is really friendly.  If your in the area, stop in for a pint.
So glad this taproom is open! I've tried the beers through their curbside service but today was so much fun! Thomas was such a great help! I'm hoping to come back soon!
These people make the best sours I've ever had and are super friendly, 100% of the time.  I'm always anxious to try their latest and it never disappoints!
Lots of unique beers here. Definitely one of my top 3 breweries in Charlotte.
Excellent clean beer. Cool space. Dog friendly.
James was great. Very informative.  Definitely in the right place. #sundayr&r #beerheaven #divinebarrel

Nice brewery although it had some sort of unusual smell like something had burned there.  Service was very pleasant and there were lots of ipa beers and sour beers. Very large space. The area with the sofas was cozy. Not bad but there is fierce competition in the area.

No flights but you can buy by the pour which is very cool for those of you wanting to experience a brewery but not a fan of beer. Try out as many or as few as you want. I tried the Carolina Cobbler-Peach and it was delicious. Highly recommend if you're not a big fan of typical beers. If you like sweet & dark try the defensive pancake. They have a variety of different options for all types of beer drinkers and have some non-alcoholic drinks for all the saints out there. Brought my wife here for her birthday and she enjoyed it a lot! They also have a few table games and a Nintendo 64.

Oh and when a train passes raise your glasses!!
Love the innovation with there beers. Every time I'm there, they blow my mind
Highly recommend the berliners, but the one dark beer was also excellent.  They also fill crowlers properly with a rinse and CO2.

My FAVORITE brewery in Charlotte without a doubt. Divine Barrel offers a wide range of rotating beers, and Ben (brew master) comes up with delicious new recipes all the time. I didn't drink any beer at all, until I tasted their sours, which are absolutely delicious. I since had to change my diet to gluten free, but that's no problem thanks to rotating kombucha, ciders, a wonderful wine list, and delicious ginger ale from GA. The staff are absolutely fantastic and make you feel like you're part of their family. If you're into running or you want to try it out, come on Thursdays for Divine Barrel Brewing run club (RunDBB). It's a super laid back and welcoming group with all paces and they offer 1, 2, and 3 mile routes. The ambience is super nice, I especially love the hanging plants and that they allow dogs. There's also a bunch of table top games that are fun and addictive. If you haven't tried DBB yet, you're missing out.

After the holidays we were ready to find something but it was new year's day so kinda hard. Got a bite around the corner... then something caught my eye... walked yup and it was divine... literally and figuratively! Amazing beer! Staff is nice and chill.  Vibe is good(hopefully doesn't change to typical noda) games to play, and ppl to meet! Def coming back.

Good little brewery thats starting tongeow its roots in the Charlotte area and theyre ever growing taplist of beers! Went and had their defensive pancake last night which was phenomenal! Friendly staff great atmosphere.. cant wait to see whats to come with them. Keep up the great work
Great atmosphere! Friendly staff! Best of all, great beer! The Universe is a Donut Stout is a keeper!
One of our favorite spots in town. Great sized tap room with plenty of seating. Love the games they have on the tables and you can't beat the variety of beers on tap.
Great beer.  Great staff.  Try the Hipster Hair....or any of them really, can't go wrong.

The beer's always good when it's barrel-aged in the NoDa 'hood!

This spacious brewery offers a variety of highly-stylized beers that will impress even the staunchest of beer snobs.

With ampleparking + seating they also offer plenty of types of entertainment to enjoy between sips including video, bar, and old school games .

They are also dog-friendly and Lynx Blue Line adjacent, so you come on down and raise a glass w/every train pass!

Staff is friendly & accommodating.

My one little thing is I tend to shy away from places that price their sample size 5oz pours individually. While it's great to not be forced to try a set amount or have the the freedom to not be restricted to a fixed number; it can get expensive, fast! Rather than a prix-fixe price of a flight from $7-12 at most breweries, depending on which beers you get, your tab can add up quick.

But, that aside, I definitely enjoyed my visit here!
One of my absolute favorite neighborhood spots. Great IPA's with flavorful sours and a constantly changing tap of odd and different beers. A must try beer experience.

I really liked this brewery , specially that they have a 5 oz option which allowed me to try multiple beers , I liked every single one I tried my favorite was the porter and the Brettrospective.

They don't serve food but they had the Euro Grill food truck outside which  offers some good Bosnian and eastern European sandwiches that goes well with the beer , they also have a Vietnamese restaurant that delivers to the place .
Delicious beer
Great space, great beer, and great service (Ashley is the best!!)

I recently hosted a bridal shower in the barrel room at Divine Barrel and had a fantastic experience.  The staff was very helpful and responsive coordinating the event ahead of time and the guests loved the space.
Great brewery with plenty of seating.
Great beers, friendly staff! Delivery available from a Thai noodle place next door.
Great place, fantastic beer.

Being in town from Atlanta for a concert, my girlfriend and I were looking for a good spot to enjoy some beers and check out the local fare. This place does not disappoint. Great selection, but more importantly everything I tried meet or exceeded expectations. The staff is friendly and helpful, especially Sarahbeth who went out of her way to recommend beers but also eateries in the area. If I lived here I would be a regular.
Really fun atmosphere and chill place to hangout.
Stopped in from out of town. Great place. Will be back again when in town. Awesome selection of sour beers. Cute table top games. Large tap room, but very cozy.
The beer is excellent! The building is great! Both deserve a 5 star review until they poured a good beer in a plastic cup.
One of the best breweries in Charlotte!

Good folks
Great b33r$

Always changing the options and always brewing up really creative yet, tasty stuff. Very unlike the hop-heavy other microbreweries in the area, typically have something for self-proclaimed "non-beer drinkers"

Update: Came back today, and realized that they had THREE red blends to choose from on the wine list (and quite a few other options too). Maybe I didn't look last time, but that's rare. Made it really easy to pick something for my wife and I who weren't in the mood for beer today, but wanted to take a friend to try their IPA.
Authentic
Cool place

Great addition to the Charlotte brewery scene. The staff is outstanding which complements the equally great beers.  Something for everyone here, including some non alcoholic options like Kombucha and Coffee.

Easily one of the best, most unique and inventive breweries in Charlotte. We didn't have a single bad beer during our visit. Plus the space is open and awesome and the service was excellent. Definitely recommend if you're making a beer pilgrimage to Charlotte.
Food truck at the door, table top corn hole, tasty beverages, good vibe.  One more strawberry tamale please!
They've always got some stellar beers on tap and they've also got that skittles game that I can't seem to get a hang of.
Not bad. It was quiet today but overall good experience. Service was welcoming.

This is by far one of the best breweries in Charlotte. Large open space with lots of natural light, on top of the beautiful farmhouse chic decor/reclaimed feel, makes for a wonderful ambiance. Spent our day doing an engagement shoot inside the brewery with permission from the company and I can say we sampled the beer after our shoot- some of the best I've had. This place is wonderful for events, I would highly recommend booking them. The barrel room is gorgeous too. What a wonderfully aesthetically beautiful place to relax and have a great time. Food is close by too (across the way noodle restaurant).
Love it here! Dog friendly, staff is super cool and nice, and a very chill vibe - great place to hang and chat with existing friends or make some new ones!
A chill, fun atmosphere!   They frequently have live music, and I like the fact that they have outdoor space.  Very creative and unusual ales on tap as well.

Ok brewery. My first experience was on their 1 year anniversary. They bruhhh in a band and set up a tent in the rain which was a solid move. But the whole place smelled weird abd i have been in away least 100 breweries. Beer menu was good and had diversity. Only had 1 beer I didn't like but that was just my taste. Overall liked it

first visit.  it's kinda hidden on side of building, but totally worth scouting this new neighberhood brewery.  got try both IPA and stout which were top notch. though sours aren't my thing, overhearing othet patrons raving about the sours.
Tasty sours.

El espacio es increible. Hacen actividades de todo tipo como libres de trivia, clases de yoga con cerveza incluida al final, la ultima noche de miercoles hay una terapia con perritos, etc. El unico problema es que si bien hay una buena cantidad de cervezas, no me toco probar una sobresaliente. Todas eran buenas pero no lo mas memorable del lugar. No falla pero no es el gran exito que se pueda desear.
Every beer they brew in every category is great.  Little pricey, but the beer is excellent.  Also nice they're open till 10pm on Sunday.

Consistently good beer and friendly service. I really like the layout here as well. Plus, they are open earlier than a lot of other breweries which is great for date days or getting some work done while you sip some delicious brews!
Good beer, good atmosphere and good serving staff. I enjoyed their beers and will definitely return.  Try it when in north Charlotte.
Great place. Service is excellent. Bartender even talked to our group for an extended time about brewing while the place was packed!
Awesome brewery, clean and spacious. Good beer too! Stopped in on a whim while traveling through Charlotte and was very glad we did.
Nice brewery, great beer options. Lots of flavors! Staff was super friendly and helpful also cool games to play around the bar we'll be back soon!

Nice atmosphere, good beer. The night I went they had live music which was very nice. They offer a wide array of different beers including several sours which I enjoyed very much. Very friendly and attentive staff.
Great tasting room with excellent beers. No food.
Best beers in Charlotte! Excellent atmosphere and cool, new food trucks all the time!
Great atmosphere and great beer!  Just needs a permanent food option.

So I was very impressed with their beers!!! The cranberry ginger....the pancake porter....the mr green geans....all were great! Service was great...bartenders knew the beers very well and helped to create an atmosphere that was welcoming.   The space had great games! I will definitely go back.

The beer here is really tasteful and there is a lot of variety in different brews. They've got everything from high gravity porters to complex sours.

The board games that they have all over are a big reason I keep coming back. It's fun to play games with friends while enjoying adult beverages
Beautiful open space, great beer, cool staff!!
In. Cred. Ible. Ice cream stout.
Super Place
Great brewery! Great staff, that cant be pretty talked by birdsong staff

Check this place out!!! MANY, many thanks to James for the sampling today!!!

I have lived in CLT for 14 years & Divine Barrel Brewing is 100% hands down my favorite new local beer spot. Their beer is insanely crispy & exquisitely fresh tasting! I'll go as far as to say it is the most uniquely flavored beer I have EVER tasted in Charlotte!

Try the 40 Dollar Bill.....Period. Get a crowler to go!

Also- they keep the best hours of any brewery in the Queen City. Opening MUCH earlier on key days instead of 4 or 5pm like most. Go find em'!

Thanks again! Best, MLM
Quaint spot with great beer!
The beers are phenomenal!
Love the concrete counter tops and bathroom sinks! Beautiful!
If you like sours try the Zest Intentions. Nice seating options with leather sofas and board games.
Great atmosphere, good beer!

Very good beer and great atmosphere.
"Cadillac rainbows" is very good sour beer.  Very new but if you're in the area def worth checking out!

The beer, staff, and environment is the best by far. I come out a couple times a week and been to other breweries and none compare to this one. One of my favorite places. Hoping they bring back Terms of endearment. Its really amazing!!
Fantastic brewery with a good selection of beers. They have games to play on their tables, and the bar has a faint wood smell which, whether intended or not, is a unique and welcomed touch.
